page.title: 11Old Customs-Children's Games
page.content: Before the era of the car children played on the roads and in the streets. There were rings or circles of various sizes in every part of the road where children played marbles. Squares were clearly marked for girls to play hop scotch. The game could go on for hours without fear of interruption and even if disturbed it would only be for a while so that the milk cart or coal cart could pass. Children used to play on their way to and from school. All children at that time walked to school every day. Some would walk four or five miles each way. It was not unusual for some children who lived in the remote parts of the village to have tea with their friends and then play well into the night before going home in safety.
